title: EPIPHRON
content:
EPIPHRON was the personified spirit (daimon) of prudence, shrewdness, careful consideration and
        sagacity.

Pseudo-Hyginus, Preface (trans. Grant) (Roman mythographer C2nd A.D.) :
        "From Nox (Night) [Nyx] and Erebus [were born] : Fatum (Fate), Senectus (Old Age), Mors (Death), Letum
        (Dissolution), Continentia (Moderation), Somnus (Sleep), Somnia (Dreams), Amor (Love)--that is Lysimeles,
        Epiphron (Prudence), Porphyrion, Epaphus, Discordia (Discord), Miseria (Misery), Petulantia (Wantonness),
        Nemesis (Retribution), Euphrosyne (Good Cheer), Amicitia (Friendship), Misericordia (Compassion), Styx (Hatred);
        the three Parcae (Fates), namely Clotho, Lachesis and Atropos; the Hesperides."
        [N.B. Hyginus does not attempt to translate the Greek name-word "Epiphron" into Latin. Several other
        names in the list are also Greek such as Nemesis and Euphrosyne.]

A complete bibliography of the translations quoted on this page.
